required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Classic Ballet Practice on School Children's Postural Balance
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Classic Ballet Practice on School Children's Postural Balance: Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Is a parallel longitudinal protocol where half patients receive a experimental protocol and the other half receive orientation to maintain your daily live routine as usually. The experimental protocol include Ballet sessions. The hypothesis is interventional group will improve the balance control more than control group.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two groups design where one group receives treatment and the other not in the same period of time.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in total score of Star Excursion Balance Test at 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the beginning and end of intervention. This measure is shown in cm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in anteriorposterior and mediolateral displacements of Pressure Center at 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the beginning and end of intervention of anteroposterior and mediolateral displacements of pressure center in cm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in average speed of Pressure Center at 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the beginning and end of average speed of pressure center in cm/s.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in 95% ellipse area of Pressure Center at 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the beginning and end of 95% ellipse area of pressure center in cm².

primary_outcome.measure: Maintenance at 30 and 60 days from baseline in total score of Star Excursion Balance Test.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate after, 30 and 60 days after intervention protocol.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the end and 30 and 60 days after intervention. This measure is shown in cm.

primary_outcome.measure: Maintenance at 30 and 60 days from baseline in anteroposterior and mediolateral displacements of pressure center
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate after, 30 and 60 days after intervention protocol.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the end and 30 and 60 days after intervention of anteroposterior and mediolateral displacements of pressure center in cm.

primary_outcome.measure: Maintenance at 30 and 60 days from baseline in average speed of pressure center
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate after, 30 and 60 days after intervention protocol.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the end and 30 and 60 days after intervention of average speed of pressure center in cm/s.

primary_outcome.measure: Maintenance at 30 and 60 days from baseline in 95% ellipse area of pressure center
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate after, 30 and 60 days after intervention protocol.
primary_outcome.description: Changing between the end and 30 and 60 days after intervention of 95% ellipse area of pressure center in cm².

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediate after, 30 and 60 days after intervention protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Stiffness estimate by force plate data and displament of center of mass

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak and absortion rate of ground reaction force
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediate after, 30 and 60 days after intervention protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Greatest value and absortion rate (between inicial contat and peak) of ground reaction force

other_outcome.description: Assessed by final score of Physical Activity Questionnaire for Children. The score questions are about daily physical activity of children. Final score is a mean calculate by 9 items/questions with range 1 to 5. A final score of 1 (minimum) indicates low physical activity, whereas a score of 5 (maximum) indicates high physical activity.

arm_group.description: Subjects who will receive the experimental protocol.
Subjects who will not receive the experimental protocol, only will be on a wait list.

intervention.description: The classic ballet classes will respect biological limits of children. The sessions will be 75 minutes long, twice a week during 8 weeks. The class sequence will be: warm-up, follow by exercises about upper and lower limbs ballet positions and sequences of ballet jumps, and at the end a cool-down.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female sex
- 9 to 12 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Musculoskeletal pain at last 3 months
- Perform other physical activity besides scholar's physical activity
- Has been participated Ballet class.
